surgerydetails.line1: I will be outside the Co-op every other Saturday between the hours of 10:00 & 12:00. If you would like to meet regarding a specific issue or would like an appointment, please email or write to me.
surgerydetails.line2: Besides the local surgery, I am willing to attend any relevant meetings / events across the District if invited. I work full time 0700 - 1700 Monday to Friday so please do not think I am ignoring you, I will reply to any correspondents after work.

surgerydetails.line1: Every Friday morning at Aylesham House between 10 - 12pm.

councillor.keyposts: Portfolio Holder for Access and Licensing
Portfolio Holder for Environment, Waste and Planning
Portfolio Holder for Property Management and Public Protection

surgerydetails.line1: Although I do not hold formal surgeries I am always available to residents in my ward (Little Stour and Ashstone Ward which covers Ash, Wingham, Preston, Staple, Stourmouth, Goodnestone and Chillenden) via e-mail at cllrmichaelconolly@dover.gov.uk or by telephone on 01227 722979.
To be as available as possible, there are ten different ways for residents of Maxton, Elms Vale and Priory ward to contact me:
surgerydetails.line3: • By post. The address is below.
surgerydetails.line4: • At my surgery: I hold a weekly surgery every Friday evening between 6-7pm at Costa Coffee in Biggin Street, Dover. Please contact me in advance to book a place.
surgerydetails.line5: • Face to face: By making an appointment to see me at a mutually convenient time and place. Costa Coffee or the Discovery Café in Dover Library, are convenient locations.
surgerydetails.line6: • With a home visit: I can make a home visit to elderly and disabled members of the public who are unable to travel to my surgery.
surgerydetails.line7: • Online: I am available for an e-surgery on Skype. My username is CllrPWallace.
surgerydetails.line8: • Online: I am available on twitter (@CllrPWallace) and facebook (www.facebook.com/CllrPWallace).

surgerydetails.line1: The Labour councillors for the Mill Hill ward have regular surgeries on the last Friday of every month in the Eden Café in St Richards Church at the top end of St Richards Road, Deal. Occasional surgeries are also held in Magness House, on Mill Hill, as well as occasional street surgeries.
surgerydetails.line2: Dover and Deal Labour Party holds regular street surgeries attended by elected councillors and volunteers. Full details of surgeries are available through Dover and Deal Labour Party, 26 Coombe Valley Road, Dover CT17 0EP (tel: 01304 201199) or I can be contacted directly at: 28 St Richards Road, Deal CT14 9JR (tel: 01304 368330).

councillor.keyposts: Portfolio Holder for Housing, Health & Wellbeing

surgerydetails.line1: Available by appointment, telephone or letter

councillor.keyposts: Portfolio Holder for Skills, Training, Tourism, Voluntary Services & Community Safety

surgerydetails.line1: Councillor Brivio holds regular surgeries monthly at the following locations/times:
surgerydetails.line2: The Ark, Noahs Ark Road, Dover and Beacon (Footprints), London Road, Dover
surgerydetails.line4: Contact 07772471905 for detail of exact dates
